etymologies: early 17th century: from modern Latin mamillaris, from mamilla (see mammilla). The spelling variant of -mm- was due to association with mammary

definitions: shaped like or resembling a breast or nipple.
shortDefinitions: shaped like or resembling breast or nipple

definitions: (of a mineral) having several smoothly rounded convex surfaces.
shortDefinitions: (of mineral) having several smoothly rounded convex surfaces

definitions: denoting two rounded bodies in the floor of the hypothalamus in the brain
shortDefinitions: denoting two rounded bodies in floor of hypothalamus in brain
